Name: Agonda Beach
Description: It’s long and lonely, fringed with palms and casuarinas and dominated by a large hill to the south

Name: Aguada Beach
Description: Aguada beach is almost synonymous with the top-notch Fort Aguada Hotel complex

Name: Anjuna Beach
Description: It is located about 18kms from Panaji and is situated in Bardez taluka

Name: Arambol (Harmal) Beach
Description: The black rocks on the silvery beach make for some pretty dramatic scenery at sunset.

Name: Ashvem Beach
Description: This beach offer delightful ocean vistas fringed by the green fronds of the sway coconut palms that pepper the shore.

Name: Baga Beach
Description: This is part of a 30 km stretch of beach coastline along the west coast of Goa

Name: Bambolim Beach
Description: Located in North Goa, this peaceful little beach is a haven for those who want to enjoy the sand and surf without the crowds that pepper most of the other beaches in North Goa

Name: Betalbatim Beach
Description: North of Colva is Betalbatim Beach which begins a long string of beaches with Majorda, Utorda, Arossim and Velsao at the north. It is a ten kilometre stretch of white sand which is not very crowded.

Name: Betul Beach
Description: Betul is one of the most important fishing ports where all the mechanized boats and deep sea trawlers bring in their catch

Name: Benaulim Beach
Description: Benaulim is one of the few places in Goa where one can glimpse handicrafts typical to this area

Name: Bogmalo Beach
Description: This beach dominated by a huge 5-star hotel located right on its edge and is cut apart from both the North and South beach circuit

Name: Calangute Beach
Description: Calangute is the beach to which everyone heads for the moment they land in Goa

Name: Candolim Beach
Description: Candolim is the first beach that can be approached from the city of Panaji

Name: Cavelossim Beach
Description: The extremely beautiful Cavelossim beach is situated between the Arabian Sea on one hand and the Sal River on the other.

Name: Colva Beach
Description: This is the most important beach in the south circuit equipped with all modern amenities like air-conditioned resort complexes

Name: Galgibaga/Turtle Beach
Description: The beach itself is a pristine stretch of golden brown sand, fringed with coconut palms and other trees.

Name: Majorda Beach
Description: This small stretch beach stretches about 5 Kms north of Colva Beach along the coastline

Name: Miramar Beach
Description: This beautiful beach is located about 3kms from Panaji

Name: Mobor Beach
Description: Mobor Beach is one of the pristine beaches in South Goa that attracts hordes of tourists every year from all over the country.

Name: Morjim Beach
Description: The VIPs on this beach are the Olive Ridley turtles that come to nest here helped by a group of volunteers who guard the nests and help the hatchlings get into the sea.

Name: Palolem Beach
Description: It’s a beach of white sand facing a blue bay between two headlands

Name: Patnem Beach
Description: The Patnem Beach is one of the quietest and most secluded beaches of South Goa.

Name: Sinquerim Beach
Description: With a magnificent 17th century fort which has now been converted into a prison

Name: Vagator Beach
Description: This beautiful beach is located about 22 Kms from Panaji and is situated in Bardez taluka

Name: Varca Beach
Description: Varca is a 12 km stretch of marvelous white sandy beaches in South Goa
